title: Barmston and Fraisthorpe To Bridlington Beach Walk Route

nearby.description: Bridlington to Flamborough Head Coastal Walk

images.title: JThomas / Barmston Duck Pond
images.caption: Barmston Duck Pond. You could start the walk in the pretty little village if you prefer. It's about a 5 minute stroll down to the beach from here.

images.title: Peter Church / South Bank and Barmston Sands
images.caption: South Bank and Barmston Sands. Looking south along the clay cliffs. In the distance is the outflow structure for the Barmston Main Drain. The beach at Barmston was awarded the Blue flag rural beach award in 2005

images.title: Oxana Maher, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Eroded cliff path, Barmston

images.title: The Hollies in Fraisthorpe by peter robinson, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The Hollies in Fraisthorpe

images.title: Paul Glazzard / Auburn Sands
images.caption: Dogs at Auburn Sands. Low tide on the beach east of the lost medieval village of Auburn. The former villages of Auburn and Hartburn have been abandoned due to coastal erosion.

images.title: Weaponry on Bridlington North Pier by John H Darch, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Weaponry on Bridlington North Pier

description: This coastal walk takes you along the East Yorkshire coast from Barmston to Bridlington via Fraisthorpe and Auburn. The flat easy walk passes along the lovely sandy beach with fine views throughout. It runs for a distance of just under 5 miles. You can start the walk from the public car park on the sea front at Barmston. Then head north along Barmston Sands, Fraisthorpe Sands, and Auburn Sands where you will pass the site of the medieval village of Auburn. The final section takes you past Wilsthorpe and Hilderthorpe before passing along Bridlington's South Sands and finishing at the pier. You can extend your outing on the Bridlington to Flamborough Head Coastal Walk. This continues north to Flamborough Head where you can enjoy wonderful cliff top views and look out for a wide variety of sea birds.
display_address: Barmston Beach Holiday Park, Sands Lane, Barmston, East Riding of Yorkshire, England, YO25 8PJ, United Kingdom
